summary: The Achieving Choice in Education Act (ACE Act) aims to incentivize education through amendments to the Internal Revenue Code. Key provisions include expanding eligible expenses for 529 education savings accounts to include homeschooling and various elementary/secondary costs, raising the distribution limit from 529 plans, and modifying gift tax exclusions for contributions to 529 plans. Furthermore, the bill restricts tax-exempt bonds to states with school choice programs, setting eligibility criteria based on the percentage of eligible students and funding levels.
